uCWewgpY5noFSPPj68V-FA.text: I would commit murder for one of these heavenly tarts. Having tasted a whole range of cheese tarts from Pablo to KFC (which was surprisingly decent), Bake trumps its rivals by a large margin. The buttery crust is firm and manages to hold together throughout the plate-to-mouth journey. Cheese filling is the right balance of sweet & savory, which produces the most divine flavor burst in one's mouth. Breaks my heart to drop $3.50 on just ONE tart, but sometimes this indulgence is necessary! Protip: if you're getting it to-go, microwave for 3 minutes to get the cheese filling gooey again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. The insides pre-microwaving
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. 2!!! Such a luxury

O5lnmofrmtvaYAzsuK974w.text: Before I came to singapore, I heard there are many places selling cheese tarts. One of the cheese tart place was close to my hotel. Bake Cheese Tart from Hokkaido, have a crumbly exterior, fluffy inner texture, and cheesy warm soft filling!! I heard it has up to 3-hour long waiting lines. When I got there, I saw a long line outside of the bakery. But I only waited 15-20mins. If I could, I wanted to buy more but I had to be satisfied with one dozen. It is SD 3.50 per piece.It is just the most heavenly cheese tarts. One of the best cheese tart I've ever tasted. If it could last long, I would have bought several boxes to bring home. It's freshly baked, just so soft and melts in your mouth. I couldn't stop eating them. Sometimes I still dream about the delicious tarts!

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore

RjvjpVElEQx_4wuceIoMXQ.text: Oh my dear Bake.. why oh why, can't you come to the US??? I've tried the impersonators and it's just NOT the same. Last time I visited I had to wait in a long line to try these tasty treats but luckily this time I was able to walk up and get my favorite treat. SO delicious - if you haven't tried 'em you seriously need to ASAP! :)

CNmOdz0F6zGQfNniOu4ZZA.text: Full of hype? Check.Lives up to its hype? Check.I was lucky to be at ion at 11am on a Wednesday morning and there were only 3 people in line. I joined the line hoping to try this famous cheese tart.Every customer is only allowed to buy 12, and I ended up getting a dozen, because well, I'm already in line so why not?? The tarts are super delicious when they are fresh out of the oven. Sinfully rich but not too much that it makes you sick. They are pretty pricey at $3.50 per tart, but well, I'm only here once a year.

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore

vZjU_POooJ5gS8x2RXHPvg.text: Line was long but moved fast. $3.50 per and $19.50 for six pieces. The cheese tarts are light and melt in your mouth. The cheese is a little gooey once bitten. It's a perfect accompaniment with tea or coffee. I wish I were able to bring this back home... I am already dreaming of eating more.

ZswdUd5Jlu1FxzZpY0FeQA.text: Its located near the candy store at the Ion mall. Love the original flavor, inside of tart was light as air almost foam like. The other alternative is the chocolate which i think is too sweet and taste like Milo

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore

O3D3-20HkAigzgCf5oDD0g.text: At $3.50 a tart, I feel like a baller for ordering 8 tarts. There is only one item in their menu, which is the yellow tart that you see in the pictures. The tart reminds me of cheesecake filling that has been accidentally put inside the microwave.I refrigerated the tart overnight and it tasted like cheesecake. In the website, it also suggested to freeze the tart for an ice-cream like texture. Pretty cute concept.  The tart shell was buttery and holds up to its molten filling well. The shell was not at all soggy. Overall, this is a good tart, but it was not mind blowing. I would not queue more than 10 minutes to buy this. The start of the queue starts some distance from the store. It is under the escalator near the Royce chocolate shop. They hand you a number after you have reached the head of the queue, you walk to the store and pass your number to the person in the store and then place your order.

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Tarts on display
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Boxes
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Cheese tart

t6WVf0qa7eOgv0Xpa3WMWw.text: Super good!!! Heavenly tarts. But the strange thing is the line was nowhere to be seen. Then we found out that the line was someplace else! How thoughtful of the staff so as not to block the way. The tarts were So Yummy. 5 stars. Go get it now. A tat expensive thought. I guess they need to recoup as their packaging was top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. The inside of pure edible gold...
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore

h1y_o6xDT2RcQatGSVDEYQ.text: Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.Baked Cheese Tarts are the new in thing people! Especially with the famous Japanese BAKE Inc. (BAKE) leading the trend come 29 Apr 2016 with their first S.E.A flagship in Singapore! Located at ION Orchard, the Singapore store will be BAKE CHEESE TART's flagship store for Southeast Asia. YAY. For those not in the know yet, BAKE hails from Hokkaido, Japan, and that ensures the creamiest and smoothest cream cheese mousse in the snappiest shortcrust tart. The cheese mousse is created by blending three different types of cream cheese together - two from Hokkaido and one from France. The pastry goes through a two-step process which leaves it with a distinct crunchy yet fluffy texture. Absolutely gorgeous i tell you.  To ensure the highest quality, the cheese tarts are actually produced in Hokkaido and flown over to Singapore! Baking is done here so that we can piping hot, creamy and flowy cheese tarts. Such dedication to excellence i say. We can certainly expect the same flavor and quality from BAKE and it's even fresher than if you beg a friend to bring it back for you.For $3.50 a pop, you can dig into one of these rich creamy babies. I can't imagine why anyone would stop at 1 though! Get a box of 6 for $19.50 and share the love (WITH ME PLEASE)!

CDOPs_dpgJPBAIxovCeBdg.text: I was lucky to have my cousin queue for me once so I didn't have to. Tried one of the tarts right away and instantly fell in love with it! I'm usually not a fan of something related to cheese but this is stupendous. Literally the only kind of tart I'd eat again and again in my life. It's just soooo goooood.The tarts are really yummy but the price is a bit on a high side (@$3.5) but I guess that's fine considering the tarts are flown in from Hokkaido and the rental in Ion.Now that I have tried, I really love it and crave it every moment but I wouldn't queue more than 15 minutes. I'll repurchase IF I was in the area, and no sign of long queue.

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Love love
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Addicted
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Best cheese tart in the world

XHQGXXczRApfpp_XvrWxwQ.text: Yummmm I went close to closing time and the line was super short. I only got one to try but wish I bought more! The cheese tart is sooo creamy, light, a bit tart, and super delicious. It is more on the expensive side S$3.50 but definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore

GSAzq45QkmNZuJ1JIoPF1g.text: I happen to be in the Orchard area on a Monday morning and my first thought was "Cheese Tart for Breakfast!"  BAKE opens at 10am and I arrived less than 10 minutes before opening.  No one was at the queue, so I roamed to the store front to check things out.  The tarts are baking in the oven and one of the staff waved at me to ask me to queue.  When I got to the queue, there were three ladies waiting.  5 more minutes until opening and about 15 more people are in queue.  A staff came out to the queue right at 10am sharp to hand out confirmation cards to the first two people.  10:03am and it was my turn!  The staff looked at my baby and I and asked how many I was getting. When I said a dozen, she was like "oh, only 12, ok, here is your card" as if she was expecting me to buy more with a baby in tow. Thank you for acknowledging my baby as a person!  The cashier was very friendly and informed me that the tarts can be refrigerated up to 4 days, or kept frozen for up to one month! Don't microwave.  Reheat in toaster, oven or air fryer at 200C for 30 seconds to a minute.  Got it!  Out the door we go to try these babies.  By now my 20 month old is screaming "Chee taat Chee taat."  I carefully peeled the sticker off to open the box.  I really appreciate BAKE's thoughtfulness in designing their boxes.  Each tart has it own "compartment" so they don't bump into each other and become mush.  First bite into the freshly baked tart is the crunchy crust that snaps off, then comes the warm fluffy, light and whipped cream like cheese filing that's has a hint of tartness.  The contrast of the crunchy shell and of fluffy cheese filling is heavenly.  I slurped the cheese filling down like one would with whipped cream, and finished off the crunchy crust with the next few bites.  15 mins late, after I settled by baby down for a drink, the cheese tart shells are getting softer and losing its crunchiness.  Now it has become more of a soft cookie texture.  When I got home, put some in the fridge, and a couple in the freezer to try the different ways of eating these babies.  The refrigerated ones tasted just ok.  It's sort of like an over beaten cheesecake, nothing like ice cream.  While the filing is soft, it has a lot of air bubbles, so it's not creamy.  The frozen ones were more like frozen cheesecake, hard and crumbly.   Hubby and my children tried it and no one care for the frozen ones.  So my conclusion is that the BAKE cheese tarts are best eaten right after you buy them.  Enjoy the contrast of crunchy cookie shell and the fluffy whipped filling.  Are they worth 1-3 hr wait? Nope!  If I need a cheese tart fix, the bakery across has lava cheese tarts, while not as fluffy and whipped cream like, those were creamier, cheaper, and no queue.

photos.caption: Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Fresh tarts out of the oven.  Mmmmm~~~~
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Each tart gets an egg wash before they get a second bake.
Photo of Bake Cheese Tart - Singapore, Singapore. Each box contain six tarts, with a divider that separate them and keep them from sliding around.
